home.educationIntro: I have been studying Front End Development at Medieinstitutet, focusing on modern technologies like React, TypeScript, and UX design.
home.cvIntro: I have a diverse background with a focus on problem solving, structure, and creativity.
home.contactText: You can reach me by email, or visit the contact page to send a message.

hero.name: Anna Karlsen
hero.title: < Front End Developer />
hero.quote: Once you stop learning, you start dying
hero.text1: It’s probably not that bad? However, I believe it’s important to continuously grow and learn new things.

edu.title: About the Education
edu.intro: In October 2023, I started the Media Institute's remote education program to become a Front End Developer. On May 27, 2025, it was time for graduation after four fantastic, informative, and intensive semesters resulting in 400 YH credits.
edu.coursesDescription: The education included courses in HTML and CSS, JavaScript (basic and advanced), API development, Agile project work, UX & Usability, graphical tools for interface design, working methodology for developers, testing, thesis and LIA periods for internship. In addition, we also had lectures by external parties to gain a deeper understanding and insight into the industry.
edu.liaDescription: LIA was an important part of the education where I gained practical experience within the industry. During my LIA periods, I worked on real projects to apply my skills in a real work environment. This gave me the opportunity to build my network and gain valuable insight into working life as a Front End Developer.
edu.lia1Desc: During LIA 1, which I did at The Nightingale Project, I initially focused on applying my knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. I then delved into React by refactoring an existing project to give it a responsive design.
edu.lia2Desc: During LIA 2 I was back at The Nightingale Project. This time I got to dive deeper into modern frameworks like Angular and Next.js. I worked directly with an external partner to give their existing site created in Angular a responsive and accessible design as well as adding changes to layout and functionality.
edu.lia2More: After that, I had the opportunity to learn another framework - Next.js - which I used in a smaller project together with Tailwind and Shadcn/ui to build a stable and responsive interface.
edu.thesisDesc: Between the LIA periods, it was time for the thesis where we had the chance to demonstrate our skills as Front End Developers. The work included everything from the initial planning with an extensive document that had to be approved before starting work, and we applied everything we had learned during the education.
edu.thesisDesc2: The goal was to create a professional and user-friendly web application showcasing my competence in web development as well as planning both work and time. When the work was done, we wrote a final report reflecting on the process, the challenges we faced, and how we solved them.
edu.thesisDesc3: I chose to work on a project involving building a responsive web application focusing on user experience and accessibility with a clear target audience. During the thesis, I had the opportunity to use the latest technologies and tools in web development, including React and TypeScript.
edu.thesisDesc4: Looking back on my thesis, I am proud of what I have accomplished and the skills I have developed during the education. It has been an amazing journey that has prepared me well for my future career as a Front End Developer.
edu.certificatesDesc: After completing the education, I received a certificate confirming my competence as a Front End Developer. This certificate contains information about the courses I completed, my skills, and my performance during the education.
edu.certificatesDesc2: Additionally, I received grades for each individual course I completed, which is an important part of my CV and professional profile.

projects.title: Projects
projects.intro: Here are some of the projects I have worked on in connection to my education. Each project has given me the opportunity to apply my knowledge and skills in web development.

wordmatch.title: Word Match
wordmatch.description: My thesis project. A memo style game but to match images with words as a means to inspire small children to learn how to read and write through play. The app was built with React and TypeScript.

memory.title: Memory
memory.description: A simple memory game built in Vue.

advent.title: Advent Calendar
advent.description: An advent calendar with doors to open from December 1st that contains tips on recipes and crafts. The app is built with Vite, React and TypeScript.

numbers.title: Number generator
numbers.description: A number generator to randomly generate lines for games like Lotto, Keno, etc. The app is built with Vite, Vue and TypeScript.

christmas.title: Christmas Card
christmas.description: A digital Christmas card with various games, recipes, coloring pages, etc. and varying background images as a little Christmas greeting to family, friends and acquaintances from me and my son. The app is built with Vite, React and Typescript.

birthday.title: Birthday Card
birthday.description: A digital birthday card to send when you realize you have forgotten to buy both a card and stamps. The app is built with Next.js, TypeScript and Tailwind CSS.

endless.title: Endless Countdown
endless.description: Have you promised to get something done within a certain time? Does it turn out that it won't work? Here is a countdown without end that extends your deadline since it never reaches zero. The app is built with Vue.

details: Humanities program with a focus on languages and art.

Introductory technical education focusing on young women. Included basics in electronics, mechanics, and computer handling.
Basic training in web design, HTML, and image editing in Photoshop. Also included some project management when needed within my project group.
Multimedia education specializing in Motion Graphics Design. Tools included Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, and Premiere.

items.degree: Business Economics, Mathematics, English, French, German, and Religion
details: Distance learning in Business Economics A and B, Mathematics A, B and C, English B, French Level 1, German Level 1, and Religion A.
MMA, MIG/MAG, TIG, and gas welding.

Focus on web development and interaction design. Courses included HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript (intro and advanced), API development, agile project work, UX & usability, graphic tools for UI design, workflows for developers, testing, thesis project, and internships. Supplemented with lectures to provide industry insights and understanding.

Received service orders, maintained customer contact, and handled general office tasks.
Office assistant at client locations. Tasks varied depending on client needs.
Office assistant at client site. Included invoice coding, purchase order registration, administrative tasks, and secretarial duties.

Worked at Stockholm harbors on behalf of the Border Police Division in Stockholm County. Controlled passports, and handled entry and exit checks of visas and residence permits.
Administered parking permits for employees and travelers. Handled customer complaints.
Worked at the reception and switchboard at Norrtälje District Court.
Performed administrative duties in various sectors of social services.
